inclusion.criterion: Adult inpatients admitted to St George's Hospital London with sustained ventricular tachycardia
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: outpatients identified from the arrhythmia clinic with significant monomorphic ventricular tachycardia noted on cardiac monitoring
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Have sustained, monomorphic scar-dependent ventricular tachycardia
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Failed, unable or unwilling to tolerate anti-arrhythmic medications
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Able to have a cardiac MRI
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: At least 40 days following a myocardial infarction
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Unable to tolerate the ablation procedure due to haemodynamic instability
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 65-year-old man with history of CAD, MI, HLD, HTN, ventricular tachycardia, and syncope. He was recently discharged after a negative work-up for syncope which included the implantation of a cardiac monitoring device.
